title: Plant- Based “Beefy” Burgers These amazing plant- based burgers surprisingly imitate the texture flavor and looks of a real beef burger except without the beef! Packed full of whole grains and superfoods these are a healthier alternative to the traditional Hamburger. With Grilling season upon us these burgers are perfect for your next BBQ!
directions: -process walnuts finely in a food processor and set aside in a large mixing bowl. Process mushrooms, then add butter and pulse until incorporated. Add brown rice, oats, beets, vegan mayo, coconut aminos, garlic, chili flake, salt & pepper and process lightly. Add processed mixture to ground walnuts and mix thoroughly with spatula. Set mixture in the fridge for one hour before forming patties.
-use a ½ measuring cup or 4 oz scoop and form burgers.

- heat grill or grill pan over med/hi. Spray with pan spray. Cook patties for approx 4 mins on each side until heated all the way through. Make sure to achieve nice char on each side before flipping. Dress them up with your favorite toppings and Enjoy!
ingredients: -2 cups brown rice or other grains (ex. Bulgur, freekeh, ect.)
-8 oz Portobello mushrooms cleaned and rough chopped
-1/2 cup uncooked rolled oats (use gluten free if allergen)
-3 ounces vegan butter chilled and cubed
-2 TBLS raw red beets grated on microplane
-salt and pepper to taste ( Suggested salt amount 2 ½ tsp Sea salt or pink Himalayan salt
- your favorite hamburger buns, toppings and sauces
